chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
The defendant Chris F Brunner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Washington County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Costs of Count 2 shall be paid as a condition of probation in Count 1.  If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall not possess any alcohol or controlled substance without a valid prescription and then taken as prescribed.  

Defendant shall take prescribed medication as prescribed.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

supervisions.notes: Time served.  With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample unless previously provided.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Catherine Jane Terry.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Court makes preliminary statements.  Recess.  Reconvene.  WITNESS:  Chris F. B., Attorney Michael K.  Argument by counsel.  Court will issue oral ruling on 12-22-14.  Oral ruling scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Scheduled Evidentiary Hearing on 12-19-14 at 8:30 a.m. as Captain Miller advised the defendant has returned to the jail.  Confirmed with counsel and Atty. Kenitz.

Atty Catherine Jane Terry appearing for Def.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Captain Shirley Miller, County Atty. Bradley Stern, Agent Tom Beightol also appear.  Defendnat currently in the hospital under deputy watch.  Atty. Terry advises that the defendant is currently in the hospital and potentially in need of an emergency medical procedure to be done in Madison and defendant does not oppose any structure so he can get his proper care and defendant's probation has been revoked and currently not serving a sentence and in need of defendant obtaining treatment and determining authority.  Atty. Stern states under 302.38 the jail has inherent authority to transfer the defendant and do not believe a court order is necessary.  State makes statements and request proceed under 302.38 and wanted to present issue to the court and there will be a jail hold placed on the defendant in the Madison hospital so when will be released Washington Co. will be contacted.  Court believes there is authority for the Sheriff under 302.38 and an order of the court is not necessary.  Court removes the Evidentiary Hearing from 12-19-14.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Mike Kenitz.  Atty Peter J Cannon for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State files an Information.  Guilty plea entered to Ct. 1 and Ct. 2, Court dismissed Ct. 3 for read-in.   Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1 and Ct. 2.  Statements by counsel.  Court enters judgment.
Maintain absolute sobriety
Hearing on May 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Mike Kenitz by telephone.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant missed court as was in custody in Waukesha Co. and did not arrive here until late yesterday.  Atty. Kenitz states was court appointed on 14CM409-Br. 4 and likely will be appointed on this case as well.  Defendant currently on disability.  State rqst. some cash bond.  Atty. Kenitz advises that the Waukesha Co. case has now been resolved.  Court orders $1,000.00 cash bond.    Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Defendant rqst. court take consideration that he lost his father earlier this year and mother is in hospice and no money to get out and rqst. a signature bond and promises will return to court and pleads with the court.  Neighbor Debra D. confirms defendant's mother is in hospice.  Hearing scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
in custody

Def, Chris F Brunner not appearing.  Atty Mandy A Schepper for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Case called at 9:54 a.m.  Atty. Kenitz had sent a couple e-mails to the court on 5-2-14 indicating he was appointed in 14CM409 but not this case and that defendant also has a Waukesha Co. case 14CM778 pending where cash bond was set on 5-1-14 and defendant may not have been able to post if did not appear today.  Court reviews VineLink and does not appear defendant is in custody.
